intro: Anthocleista rhizophoroides, commonly known as the African moonseed, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is a member of the Loganiaceae family and is characterized by its climbing habit and palmate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its medicinal properties, it has been used in traditional African medicine for various ailments.
